---
title: "Power BI Works for Power Accountants"
---

## Description

This course is to equip accountants with strong foundations to handle a variety of common accounting tasks. We will go through a number diverse hands-on projects such as financial reporting and budget management tasks, without relying on additional paid add-ons. By the end of the course, you can expect to have solid understanding how Power BI works. Even better, you will walk away with tangible projects that you have built, either to demonstrate your skills or to reference later. We will also cover best practices for data visualizations and dashboard design to enhance communication effectiveness, which can be easily overlooked.  This course is **beginner-friendly** and **lab-style**. It starts with basics and quickly rises to intermediate/advanced techniques to focus on solving real world problems.  

## Length

20 hours.

## Key Takeaways

Upon completion of this course, you will understand:

- Main concepts about Power BI (Power Query, Data Analytics Expressions, Data Modelling) and how and why they exist to work together
- How to use Power BI to handle a variety of financial tasks such as building financial statements, budget reports, variance analysis, KPI management 
- Best practices in data visualizations and dashboard design techniques and how they can make your reports effective and stand out 
- Introduction to relational databases, SQL and server-client computing
- Analytics engineering mindset and product management mindset and why they matter deeply to your Power BI projects

## Target Audience

This course appeals to several demographics: 

- **Analysts/staff accountants**, especially who 

  a. are tasked/interested in enhance budget reporting with Power BI and have access to ledger-level details as a data source, 

  b. want to advance skills in developing Power BI report products, or

  c. want to improve effectiveness of data visualization and dashboard desgins;

- **Managers**, especially who

  a. seek inspirations to improve team's budget management productivity with Power BI, 
  
  b. lead modernization projects in FP&A area (financial planning and analysis), 
  
  c. want to understand common best practices contribute to effective data visualization, or

  d. want to stay relevant with staff and colleagues about Power BI projects and effective data visualization techniques

## Prerequisite(s)

No previous knowledge about Power BI required. This is beginner friendly session.

To get the most out of this session, you should have a few years of experience using Microsoft Excel. You should be comfortable with concepts like Pivot Tables, lookups, and basic functions such as SUM and SUMIFS.
